Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to interpret the event log and produce a POWL model that captures the observed behavior The log includes multiple cases with variations sometimes the process goes through IQC and maybe repeats IQC and AS multiple times sometimes it goes through RT and TST loops sometimes labeling LB is skipped sometimes no IQC RT at all

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: it appears that after OR MS QS are sequential The timestamps show OR then MS then QS always in that order and no concurrency observed They seem to happen in order and timestamps are increasing Typically OR then MS then QS So they are ordered

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Then we have a phase of Assembly AS and Inline Quality Check IQC that may repeat In some cases we see patterns like AS then IQC then AS again maybe multiple times It seems that IQC is a check after assembly if something fails it might require redoing assembly Actually the pattern After QS they do AS then IQC Then if IQC fails they go back to AS The log shows sometimes AS IQC AS So indeed there is a loop that repeats AS and IQC until IQC passes

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Possibly the model includes a loop between AS and IQC AS IQC In a loop node you execute the first child body then either you exit the loop or execute second child rework and then A again repeating until the loop is exited

Name: Validation - NE
Text: In standard loop semantics A B means execute A then optionally B then A again etc It never yields two Bs in a row Here we saw AS IQC IQC AS That is A B B A That is not directly representable by a simple loop with two children body and rework because you would not have consecutive B without an A in between

Name: Backtracking - PE

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE

Name: Backtracking - PE
